field.label: The organisation meets the EU definition of an SME
field.hint: According to EU state aid law: The category of micro, small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) is made up of companies that employ fewer than 250 people and either have an annual turnover not exceeding EUR 50 million or an annual balance sheet total not exceeding EUR 43 million.

field.label: Description and Reflection
field.hint: Please describe the condition or requirement and how it is dealt with in the project.

field.label: Title / Key information
field.required: You must enter a title.

field.label: Challenges and associated specific activities for gender mainstreaming in the project team.

Gender aspects in the research question: (e.g. Does your research question directly address a gender issue? Does your research question indirectly touch on issues related to differences between the genders)?
Gender aspects in the state of research: (e.g. Are there any gender specific findings in the state of research with regard to the problem addressed?)
Gender relevance in research and project design: (e.g. Is the category gender systematically taken into account in data collection and/or methods? Are gender aspects considered in the interactions?)

Gender aspects regarding the application and impact of R&D results: (e.g. Are women a relevant user group of the results? Were gender-specific aspects taken into account when developing a innovation/ application)
Please briefly explain why gender aspects are relevant or not relevant in your R&D process.
Title / Key information
field.required: You must enter a title.
field.hint: Please select a meaningful title for the relevant ethical aspects.

field.label: 1) Does your research involve human participants? (This refers to any research involving work with human beings as research or study participants, regardless of its nature or topic. Examples: collection of biological samples, personal data, medical interventions, interviews, observations, tracking or the secondary use of information provided for other purposes, e.g. other research projects, officially collected information, social media sites.)

2) Does your research involve processes of personal data? (This refers to any which involves processing of personal data, regardless of the method used (e.g. interviews, questionnaires, direct online retrieval). Personal data means information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person).

3) Does your research involve the use of elements that may cause harm to humans, including research staff? (The health and safety of all human participants in research - as subjects, investigators or uninvolved third parties - must be a priority in all research studies).
4) Does your research involve animal experiments? (This refers to the use of animals in research in various forms of experiments, procedures or techniques).

5) Does your research involve the use of elements that may cause harm to the environment, to animals or plants? Does your research deal with endangered fauna and/or flora /protected areas? (This section concerns research with materials or elements that may adversely affect the biological diversity and/or the resilience of the environment.)

6) Are there any other ethics issues that should be taken into consideration? (Since research funding intends to support new paths in research, it may be that your research raises new ethical issues and concerns that are currently not (fully) covered by the issues aboved mentioned.)

If the answer to any aspect is "Yes", please specify what measures you will take to ensure the integrity of the research and the compliance with ethical standards (ethical principles and legal requirements) in the project. (Please pay attention to the information in the attached document.)

7) Do your R&D results cross frontiers of ethical acceptance? (e.g.: Is there societal controversy about your research and its results that includes ethical aspects of humans, animals or the environment? Are you or other research institutions engaged in similar research subject to (continuous) critical obversation by societal actors?)

8) Does your research concern dual-use goods or other goods requiring authorisation? (Dual-use items are normally used for civilian purposes, but may have military applications or may contribute to the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction.)

9) Does your research have a potential for misuse of research results? (e.g.: Could the materials/methods/technologies and knowledge involved or generated harm humans, animals or the environment if they were modified or enhanced? What would happen if the materials/methods/technologies and knowledge involved or generated ended up in the wrong hands? Could the materials/methods/technologies and knowledge involved or generated serve purposes other than those intended? If so, would such use be unethical?)

If the answer to any aspect is "Yes", please specify what measures you will take to ensure the integrity of the research and the compliance with ethical standards (ethical principles and legal requirements) in the project. (Please pay attention to the information in the attached document.)
